item.description:
The former U.S. Poet Laureate will read from his work, accompanied by jazz improvisers Rakalam Bob Moses and Andrew Urbina on drums and saxophone. This will mark the third time these performers have collaborated; asked to describe the experience, Pinsky offered these lines from his poem, "Ginza Samba":

It is like falling in love, the atavistic
Imperative of some one
Voice or face—the skill, the copper filament,
The golden bellful of notes twirling through
Their invisible element from
Rio to Tokyo and back again gathering
Speed in the variations . . .

Concerts in the Courtyard at the Central Library in Copley Square occurs every Friday, 12:30 – 1:30 from June 19 – August 28. Admission is free. Lunch specials will be available, courtesy of The Catered Affair.
